polimi.reds.broker.overlay
Class LinkSubstitutionInfo

java.lang.Object
  polimi.reds.broker.overlay.LinkSubstitutionInfo
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class LinkSubstitutionInfo
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Contains information about a new link that has replaced another link during a reconfiguration operation. In a tree overlay network, a link can replace another if they both connect the same sub-trees of the overlay.
When using the Informed Link Activation reconfiguration protocol, the topology manager uses this class in the NeighborDead events to inform the reconfigurator when a previously existing link between the local broker and the dead broker is replaced by a new link.
The new link can be between two brokers different from the ones in the old link; between a broker that was in the old link and a broker that was not in the old link; or even between the same brokers as the ones in the old link.

Author:
Andrea Milani
See Also:

Method Summary
 NodeDescriptor getNewLinkBrokerInOtherSubTree()
          Returns the broker which is the end of the new link in the sub-tree containing the old neighbor of the local broker.

          Returns the broker which is the end of the new link in the sub-tree containing the local broker.

Method Detail

getNewLinkBrokerInSameSubTree

public NodeDescriptor getNewLinkBrokerInSameSubTree()
Returns the broker which is the end of the new link in the sub-tree containing the local broker.

Returns:
the broker of the new link in the same sub-tree as the local broker.

getNewLinkBrokerInOtherSubTree

public NodeDescriptor getNewLinkBrokerInOtherSubTree()
Returns the broker which is the end of the new link in the sub-tree containing the old neighbor of the local broker. The old neighbor is the broker which was linked to local broker in the old link.

Returns:
the broker of the new link in the same sub-tree as the old neighbor.

getReconfId

public ReconfigurationId getReconfId()
Returns the ReconfigurationId of the reconfiguration operation.

Returns:
the ReconfigurationId of the reconfiguration operation.
